snippet: An airstrike that mistakenly killed five American soldiers and one Afghan in June was caused by a series of avoidable instances of miscommunication among air and ground forces, according to a report by military investigators released Thursday.
abstract: United States Central Command, which oversees operations in Afghanistan, releases report blaming miscommunication for airstrike that mistakenly killed five American soldiers and one Afghan in June 2014.
lead_paragraph: An airstrike that mistakenly killed five American soldiers and one Afghan in June was caused by a series of avoidable instances of miscommunication among air and ground forces, according to a report by military investigators released Thursday.

headline.main: Miscommunication Blamed for Mistaken U.S. Airstrike in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan: Miscommunication Blamed for Mistaken U.S. Airstrike

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
